page.title: 03Cattle Farming
page.content: The morning milking session now sems to begin later than it used to,probably because new machinery takes less time.Most farmers today spoke of starting around 7a.m.rather than 5.30a.m.which older workers remembered.It now takes about an hour.Next the cattle, calves and any other animals have to be fed.The rest of the day might be spent selling calves at the market in York or moving/checking fences or cleaning/maintaining the fold yard and buildings or buying/repairing machinery.The evening feed varies between 6 and 8p.m.When it has finished,there is the pipe line to wash and the stock to be inspected and fed.The day might finish around 9p.m.
